session_summaries.key_investigation: Funding Fee Tracking Analyse
findings: FundingTracker Intervall war 3600s (1h) - zu lang fÃ¼r kurze Sessions
startup.py hat Default (3600s) Ã¼berschrieben - wurde gefixt
X10 liefert Funding Payments Ã¼ber /user/funding/history (exakt)
Lighter liefert cumulative Funding (z.B. total_funding_paid_out) und kann granular Ã¼ber PositionFunding abgefragt werden
Exchange CSV (lighter-funding-export) bestÃ¤tigt Funding-Zahlungen
code_changes: funding_tracker.py: Default update_interval_seconds 3600 â†’ 300 (5min)
startup.py: Hardcoded 3600 â†’ 300 (war der eigentliche Bug!)

session_summaries.key_investigation: Warum Lighter Funding um 12:00 (AVNT/RESOLV) nicht im Bot als funding_collected erscheint
findings: Root Bug (FIXED): Timestamp-Unit mismatch â†’ created_at war bereits in ms, wurde aber teils nochmal Ã—1000 behandelt â†’ Filter hat alles ausgeschlossen (msâ†’Âµs).
Lighter Endpoint Behavior: PositionFunding braucht Cursor-Pagination; Sort/Limit kann neueste Daten verstecken, wenn man nicht paginiert.
Lighter Timestamp Normalization: API liefert Timestamps in seconds (sec) â†’ muss in ms normalisiert werden fÃ¼r Vergleiche gegen Trade created_at.
X10 Endpoint Behavior: /user/funding/history kann Records zurÃ¼ckgeben, die Ã¤lter als fromTime sind â†’ Bot muss client-side filtern (paidTime >= fromTime), sonst falsche Zuordnung.
Validation Issue: KurzlÃ¤ufe endeten oft bevor FundingTracker nach 'Trades open' einen sinnvollen Cycle machen konnte.

Aktueller Remaining Root Cause: Exchange hat Positionen (z.B. Lighter=2), aber Bot-State hat keine offenen Trades ('No open trades to track') â†’ Funding wird nicht gebucht, obwohl Exchange Funding zahlt.
Konkretes Beispiel: Lighter zeigte Funding fÃ¼r AVNT Short und RESOLV Short um 12:00:00, im Log aber um 12:00 mehrfach 'No open trades to track'.
code_changes: config.py: FUNDING_TRACK_INTERVAL_SECONDS 300 â†’ 30 (nur Debug/Verification)
config.py: FUNDING_TRACKER_DEBUG False â†’ True
src/adapters/lighter_adapter.py: Cursor Pagination fÃ¼r PositionFunding + secâ†’ms Filter
src/adapters/x10_adapter.py: Defensive Filtering paidTime >= fromTime
src/funding_tracker.py: ZusÃ¤tzliche Debug Logs (Cycle open_trades, Sleep next_run_utc, Pre/Post Filter Counts)
what_worked_in_logs: FundingTracker lÃ¤uft im 30s Takt und loggt next_run_utc.
Lighter PositionFunding Fetch + Pagination funktioniert (payments/pages/total_received sichtbar).
X10 pre_filter>0 aber after_filter=0 bestÃ¤tigt: Endpoint liefert alte Records; Filter schÃ¼tzt vor False-Positives.
what_did_not_work_yet: Funding um 12:00 wurde nicht als funding_collected gebucht, weil die betroffenen Positionen/Trades zu diesem Zeitpunkt nicht als offene Trades im Bot-State existierten.

session_summaries.key_investigation: Abgleich Funding Fees: Bot-Exports (funding_fees.csv / realised_pnl.csv) vs Lighter CSV Exports (Funding/Trades) und Audit-Report
findings: Audit zeigt systematische OPPOSITE SIGNS zwischen Bot Funding Payment und Lighter Funding Payment (z.B. AVNT/WLFI/FARTCOIN/STRK/POPCAT) bei gleichen Timestamps und Position Sizes.
Audit zeigt, dass Bot-Side und Lighter-Side konsistent invertiert sind (Bot: LONG, Lighter: SHORT) fÃ¼r dieselben Markets/Zeiten.

Funding-Rate Units scheinen nicht normalisiert: Lighter-CSV nutzt Prozentstrings (z.B. -0.000087%), Bot speichert Dezimal (z.B. -0.000016). Magnitude passt nicht, was auf Unit- oder Scaling-Bug hindeutet.
Payment Distribution Analysis im Audit: Bot Ã¼berwiegend positive Payments (~72%), Lighter Ã¼berwiegend negative (~58%) â†’ starkes Signal fÃ¼r systematische Sign-Inversion.

Interne Konsistenz: realised_pnl.csv funding_fees matchen die Werte aus funding_fees.csv fÃ¼r identische Markets/Zeitfenster (z.B. AVNT 0.001275, FARTCOIN -0.007092, WLFI 0.002772). Das spricht dafÃ¼r, dass der Fehler vor allem in der Interpretation/Normalisierung der Exchange-Funding-Daten liegt, nicht in der spÃ¤teren PnL-Aggregation.

Hinweis: Der vom User referenzierte Logfile-Pfad funding_bot_LEON_20251215_085830_FULL.log wurde im Workspace nicht gefunden, daher konnte die Log-basierte Zuordnung in dieser Session nicht geprÃ¼ft werden.
notes: Diese Session hat keinen Code geÃ¤ndert; sie hat eine neue, klare Fehlerspur geliefert: Side-/Sign-Konvention oder Unit-Normalisierung in der Lighter-Funding-Pipeline.

session_summaries.key_investigation: Final Verification of Funding Signs, Code Logic & PnL Integration
findings: X10 Funding Sign Fix VERIFIED: Bot logs match Exchange CSV exactly (e.g., FARTCOIN -0.007041, MNT -0.001033).
CSV Cross-Check: Timestamp 1765803600 (14:00 UTC) payments confirmed in both Bot Logs and Exchange Exports.
Display Confusion Resolved: 'funding_received=$-0.0000' in logs identified as Lighter Websocket artifact (live view); actual calculation uses API (historical view) and is correct.
PnL Integration Confirmed: Code analysis (pnl_utils.py) proves 'total_pnl = price_pnl - fees + funding_collected'. Funding is correctly persisted to DB.
Lighter Adapter Code Verification: Explicit 'AUDIT FIX' logic found (`funding_received = -change`) confirming sign inversion is active.
X10 Verification: Payments match CSV exactly without artificial inversion.
Remaining Minor: Lighter Rate Unit (Percent vs Decimal) affects display but not PnL calculation.
Orphan Positions: Positions existing on exchange but not in Bot State are currently ignored by FundingTracker (Known Issue).
code_changes: src/adapters/x10_adapter.py: Removed sign inversion (verified fix).

session_summaries.key_investigation: Lighter Rate Unit Display (Decimal vs Percent)
findings: Log Analysis: Lighter API returns Rate as DECIMAL (e.g. 0.000012).
Calculation Check: Payment (0.000960) / (Size 226 * Price 0.35) ~= 0.000012. This confirms the API returns the correct DECIMAL rate used for calculation.
CSV Discrepancy: Exchange CSV shows Rate as PERCENT (e.g. 0.0012% or 0.000087%). This caused confusion when comparing with Bot logs.
Fix: Updated Lighter Adapter logging to display Rate as both Decimal and Percent (e.g. 'Rate=0.00001200 (0.001200%)') to avoid future confusion.
code_changes: src/adapters/lighter_adapter.py: Enhanced logging in fetch_position_funding to show Rate in both Decimal and Percent formats.

session_summaries.key_investigation: Final confirmation of Funding Fee signs and X10 parsing logic
findings: Confirmed Lighter Adapter Sign Fix: Removed `funding_received = -change` inversion. Now uses raw `change`.
Confirmed X10 Parsing: Verified via script that negative strings (e.g. '-0.007') are parsed correctly as negative floats.
Resolved Missing Trades: ENA/TAO were found in a later log file (14:57 run), values match CSV.
Resolved RESOLV Trade: Skipped because it was closed in DB (status='closed').
Cleanup: Removed temporary debug scripts.
code_changes: src/adapters/lighter_adapter.py: Removed sign inversion.
src/adapters/x10_adapter.py: Added debug logging for sign mismatches.
Workspace: Deleted debug_x10_parsing.py, debug_bot_audit_v2.py, etc.

session_summaries.key_investigation: Implement Option B: Adoption of Orphan Positions to ensure Funding Tracking
findings: Implemented robust adoption logic in StateManager: Merges legs if one exists, creates new trade if none exists.
Lighter Adoption: Captures `funding_received` (cumulative) from API snapshot to initialize `funding_collected`. This recovers past funding history for Lighter legs.
X10 Adoption: Creates trade with current timestamp. Past funding history cannot be easily recovered via API snapshot, but future funding will be tracked.
Startup Logic: Replaced manual 'Zombie/Ghost' checks in `startup.py` with `reconcile_positions_atomic(auto_fix=True)`.
Result: Bot now automatically adopts any positions found on exchange at startup, ensuring they are tracked by FundingTracker.
code_changes: src/state_manager.py: Enhanced `reconcile_with_exchange` to merge legs and capture Lighter funding.
src/core/startup.py: Replaced manual checks with `reconcile_positions_atomic` call.

session_summaries.key_investigation: Missing Lighter Funding at 16:00 & Log Noise Reduction
findings: Missing Lighter Funding: Caused by API latency (5-15min) vs Bot Shutdown (16:05). Data simply hadn't arrived yet.
X10 Funding: Confirmed received at 16:00:40 ($0.0113).
Log Noise: identified verbose INFO logs in lighter_adapter (historical funding) and funding_tracker (heartbeats).
code_changes: src/adapters/lighter_adapter.py: Downgraded historical funding logs from INFO to DEBUG.
src/funding_tracker.py: Downgraded heartbeat logs (Sleeping/Starting) from INFO to DEBUG.

session_summaries.key_investigation: Why EDEN-USD trade was not closing despite visible profit (Arbitrage/Price Divergence)
findings: Detected massive divergence on X10: Mark Price ($0.083) vs Orderbook Mid-Price ($0.070).
Bot was using Mark Price for PnL, resulting in a false negative PnL calculation.
Real liquidity (Orderbook) offered a profitable exit, but Bot ignored it due to Mark Price reliance.
Solution: Switch PnL calculation to use Orderbook Mid-Price (Real Liquidity) instead of Mark Price.
code_changes: src/adapters/x10_adapter.py: Implemented get_orderbook_mid_price (fetches top 5 bids/asks).
src/adapters/lighter_adapter.py: Implemented get_orderbook_mid_price.
src/core/trade_management.py: Updated manage_open_trades to prioritize Mid-Price over Mark Price.

session_summaries.key_investigation: EDEN orphan churn, Ghost Guardian leakage, and X10 shutdown close failures
findings: Root cause identified: Lighter Ghost Guardian injected synthetic positions (size=0.0001, is_ghost=True) into fetch_open_positions() return, contaminating reconciliation and trade management.
Observed symptom: repeated ORPHAN POSITION closes and 'already open on Lighter' skips for EDEN-USD, plus dust quantization failure ('base amount is 0 after quantization').
Observed symptom: Shutdown incomplete for EDEN-USD on X10 with repeated CANCELLED close orders (final_close_failed:x10:EDEN-USD).
Contributing factor: X10 cancel_all_orders previously skipped during shutdown, increasing the chance reduce-only closes conflict with resting orders.
Hardening: trade management now checks close_live_position return values to avoid false 'closed' logs and reduce retry churn.
code_changes: src/adapters/lighter_adapter.py: Ghost positions no longer returned as open positions; still emitted to callbacks for fill detection.
src/core/trade_management.py: Ignore is_ghost positions; check (ok, order_id) from close_live_position before logging success; skip dust orphan closes during normal operation.
src/adapters/x10_adapter.py: cancel_all_orders now runs best-effort + bounded during shutdown instead of skipping entirely.
audit_20251216.md: Added audit write-up for these findings and fixes.

session_summaries.key_investigation: X10 shutdown close orders were repeatedly CANCELLED; implement top-of-book repricing + fix shutdown close semantics
findings: TS reference (Extended-TS-SDK-master/examples/08_close_position.ts + 09_close_all_positions.ts) uses reduceOnly + IOC with a reference price; Python needed a more deterministic executable reference price.

Python shutdown orchestration previously called X10 close with ambiguous (side,size) semantics; X10Adapter.close_live_position expects (original_side, notional_usd) and re-fetches the live position internally.
Implemented best-executable price selection for close: SELL closes start at best bid; BUY closes start at best ask; then bounded tick-aggressive repricing to reduce IOC cancellations.
Added explicit price override path so shutdown can pass a chosen reference price into order placement.
Validation: compileall OK; module import smoke check OK. pytest collection currently fails due to duplicate tests under backups/ and missing modules unrelated to this change.
code_changes: src/shutdown.py: Pass correct original_side (position side) + best-effort notional_usd into X10 close path.

src/adapters/x10_adapter.py: close_live_position uses orderbook top-of-book + bounded repricing loop; open_live_position accepts optional price override and prefers top-of-book for reduce_only IOC closes.
session_summaries.session_pnl: Verified: shutdown completed with all positions closed (see logs/funding_bot_LEON_20251216_104039_FULL.log)

session_summaries.key_investigation: Prevent unhedged exposure when Lighter maker partially fills below X10 minimum size
findings: Implemented bounded micro-fill policy: short grace, bounded max wait, unhedged USD cap, cancel + dust close.
Verification note: logs/funding_bot_LEON_20251216_110119_FULL.log did not produce a micro partial fill (1000PEPE-USD timed out then retry filled), so the policy was not exercised in that run.
code_changes: src/parallel_execution.py: replaced 60s extended-wait behavior with config-driven microfill abort+cleanup.
config.py: added MAKER_MICROFILL_* knobs with conservative defaults.
session_summaries.session_pnl: N/A (Safety hardening; verification pending on microfill scenario)

session_summaries.key_investigation: Wide spreads (e.g., ~5%) caused Maker timeouts/retries; harden entry gating to avoid hanging orders and operational risk
findings: Observed behavior: wide-spread markets can trigger Maker fill timeouts and retry loops, increasing time-in-flight and operational risk.
Fix: enforce a strict entry spread gate in Maker validation aligned with MAX_SPREAD_FILTER_PERCENT so wide-spread entries are blocked early (PHASE 0).
Fix: corrected spread timeout diagnostic logging (previously double-multiplied %).
code_changes: src/parallel_execution.py: _validate_orderbook_for_maker now enforces entry spread gate using MAX_SPREAD_FILTER_PERCENT (fractionâ†’percent).
src/parallel_execution.py: PHASE 1.5 timeout diagnostics now logs spread_percent in correct units.

session_summaries.key_investigation: X10 Account WebSocket disconnects with 1011 Ping timeout every ~5 minutes
findings: Root Cause Analysis: X10 Server disconnects after ~5 minutes of perceived inactivity on the Account stream
TS SDK Comparison: X10 TS SDK relies on WebSocket protocol-level pings (RFC 6455 Opcode 0x9/0xA) via Node.js ws library - no application-level JSON pings
Lighter TS SDK Pattern: Uses explicit JSON ping/pong ({"type":"ping"}/{"type":"pong"}) every 30s as shown in examples/ws_ping_pong.ts
Python websockets Library: ping_interval=15.0 enables automatic WebSocket protocol pings; library auto-responds to server pings when set
Key Finding: X10 does NOT respond to application-level JSON pings ({"ping":timestamp}) - pongs_received=0 after 5 sent pings
VERDICT: The existing ping_interval=15.0 on WebSocket protocol level is the CORRECT fix; application-level JSON pings are UNNECESSARY for X10
Session Duration: 4 minutes (12:09:53-12:14:05) - too short to trigger the 5-min server timeout
NO 1011 ERROR occurred in this session - WebSocket protocol pings keep connection alive
code_changes: src/websocket_manager.py: ManagedWebSocket now accepts on_pong callback for manager-level pong tracking
src/websocket_manager.py: _x10_account_ping_interval reduced from 30s to 45s (4 attempts before 5-min timeout)
src/websocket_manager.py: Keepalive loop logging enhanced with pings_sent, pongs_received, last_pong timing
src/websocket_manager.py: Pong handling moved to receive loop with on_pong callback invocation
src/websocket_manager.py: x10_account ManagedWebSocket now uses on_pong=self._handle_x10_account_pong
verification_signals: L303: Sent keepalive ping #1 (pongs_received=0, last_pong=-1s ago)
L358: Sent keepalive ping #2-5 all show pongs_received=0
L326,407: Lighter receives SERVER pings and responds correctly
session_summaries.remaining_issue: X10 EDEN-USD shutdown close still fails (all SELL orders CANCELLED) - needs separate investigation

session_summaries.key_investigation: X10 shutdown close orders were CANCELLED due to insufficient slippage on illiquid markets; implement percentage-based slippage from mark price
findings: Root Cause Identified: Tick-based slippage (aggress_ticks=[0,1,2,4,8]) resulted in only 0.11% max slippage - insufficient for illiquid markets like EDEN-USD with ~7% bid-ask spread
Evidence from Previous Log: SELL orders at $0.069-$0.070, Mark Price at $0.074-$0.075 (~7% gap) - all IOC orders CANCELLED
Solution: Replaced tick-based slippage with percentage-based slippage from mark price: [2%, 5%, 8%, 10%, 15%]
Reference Price Change: Now uses mark_price instead of best_bid (more stable for illiquid markets)
VERIFICATION SUCCESS: New log shows EDEN-USD SELL closed at attempt 1/5 with 2% slippage ($0.06674 vs mark=$0.06811)
WebSocket Stability Confirmed: 7-minute session with 0 WS 1011 errors, protocol pings working correctly
code_changes: src/adapters/x10_adapter.py: close_live_position() changed from tick-based (aggress_ticks) to percentage-based slippage (slippage_pct_steps=[0.02,0.05,0.08,0.10,0.15])
src/adapters/x10_adapter.py: Reference price changed from best_bid to mark_price for stability on illiquid markets
src/adapters/x10_adapter.py: Enhanced logging: 'ðŸ”» X10 CLOSE {symbol}: size=..., side=..., price=$... (mark=$..., slip=...%, attempt=.../5)'
verification_signals: L643: ðŸ”» X10 CLOSE EDEN-USD: size=1170.000000, side=SELL, price=$0.06674 (mark=$0.06811, slip=2.0%, attempt=1/5)
L646: âœ… X10 EDEN-USD closed and tracked
L690: âœ… All positions closed. Bye! (elapsed=10.55s)
Session Duration: 7 minutes with 0 WS 1011 errors
X10 Keepalive: 8 pings sent, protocol pings working correctly

session_summaries.key_investigation: Warum verliert der Bot Geld trotz gehedgter Positionen?
findings: PROBLEM 1 - Entry/Exit Slippage: -$79.31 (65.5% der Trades mit negativem Trade PnL)
PROBLEM 2 - Trading Fees: -$67.70 (X10 Taker 0.0225%)

Average Hold Time: ~65min aber viele Trades <10min
Funding collected: nur +$3.53 (sollte viel hÃ¶her sein)

session_summaries.root_cause_summary: Hedging funktioniert KORREKT. Verluste entstehen durch: (1) Slippage beim Ein-/Ausstieg, (2) Fees akkumulieren, (3) Trades werden geschlossen BEVOR Funding-Payments ankommen.
recommendations: Exit nur wenn Funding > (Fees + Expected Slippage)
Funding Schedule: BEIDE BÃ–RSEN = stÃ¼ndlich (1h) - X10 API: 'applied only once per hour'

session_summaries.key_investigation: WebSocket Order Client 'Invalid Type' errors + Missing Lighter SDK + SDK API Breaking Change
root_causes_found: WS Order Client: Batch TX format falsch - tx_types und tx_infos mÃ¼ssen JSON-stringified werden (per Lighter Python SDK)
WS Order Client: Heartbeat Protokoll falsch - Server sendet 'ping', Client muss 'pong' antworten (nicht 'PING')
WS Order Client: recv() Concurrency Bug - Multiple Tasks ruften gleichzeitig recv() auf
Bot 'Data=63' Filter: Lighter SDK war nicht installiert â†’ HAVE_LIGHTER_SDK=False â†’ Alle Lighter Preise/Funding fehlten
Lighter SDK v1.0.1: Breaking API Change - SignerClient.__init__() Parameter geÃ¤ndert von private_key zu api_private_keys: Dict[int, str]
ws_order_client_fixes: _prepare_batch_payload(): tx_types und tx_infos jetzt JSON-stringified per Official SDK
_cleanup_tasks(): Neue Methode - Cancelt recv/heartbeat Tasks vor Reconnect
_receive_loop(): Break on error statt endless spinning
_handle_message(): Server ping Handler - Antwortet auf 'ping'/'PING' mit 'pong'

lighter_adapter_fix.new_code: api_private_keys = {api_key_index: priv_key}; self._signer = SaferSignerClient(url=..., account_index=..., api_private_keys=api_private_keys)

sdk_installation.note: SDK nicht auf PyPI verfÃ¼gbar - muss von GitHub installiert werden!

session_summaries.key_investigation: Analyse des aktuellen FULL-Logs und Priorisierung der nächsten Fixes
top_findings: X10 account WS disconnect loop (1011 Ping timeout) massiv.
Extrem viel Funding Debug Output (Raw Response) -> IO/Loop Pressure.
Ein Maker-Timeout führte zu Ghost-Fill Hedging (TIA-USD).
recommended_fixes: WS: Pong/keepalive & event-loop responsiveness sichern; Ping timeout root-cause finden.
Orderbooks: Invalidation nur bei x10_orderbooks reconnect, nicht bei x10_account.
Logging: FUNDING Raw Response auf DEBUG + truncate + rate-limit; sensitive/large payloads vermeiden.
Execution: Maker strategy fallback (IOC/taker) und Cancel/Fill-Confirm verbessern.
WS Load: Unnötige Subscriptions reduzieren (insb. wenn deltas disabled).

session_summaries.key_investigation: Verify X10 WS stability after disabling JSON keepalive
top_findings: 0 WS 1011 timeouts and 0 reconnects in this run
recommended_fixes: Run longer soak test (>=30-60min) to confirm stability under load
Keep log level at INFO so funding debug stays muted

lighter.accuracy: Granular: exakt wenn korrekt gepaginiert + Zeitfenster korrekt (secâ†’ms).

fixed: Timestamp Unit Bug: trade.created_at in ms wurde teils erneut Ã—1000 behandelt â†’ alle Funding-Payments rausgefiltert
Lighter PositionFunding: Cursor Pagination + secâ†’ms Normalisierung fÃ¼r korrektes Zeitfenster
X10 Funding History: Client-side Filter (paidTime >= fromTime) verhindert falsche Zuordnung
Systematische Sign-Inversion / Side-Mismatch (X10): Bot-Funding-Export matcht jetzt Lighter Funding CSV (Verified)
Lighter Funding Normalisierung: Side/Sign Konvention (Verified via Code & CSV)

Lighter Sign Inversion: Removed manual inversion (-change) to match API behavior.
Orphan Position Handling: Implemented Option B (Adoption) to ensure funding tracking for all exchange positions.
Mark Price Divergence: Bot used Index Price instead of Real Liquidity Price (Fixed via Orderbook Mid-Price)
Ghost Guardian Leakage: Synthetic Lighter positions (is_ghost) were treated as real open positions in reconciliation/trade management (Fixed by restricting ghosts to callbacks only)
False Success Logging: Orphan/zombie cleanup logged 'closed' without validating close_live_position return values (Fixed)
Shutdown Cancel Skip (X10): cancel_all_orders skipped during shutdown (Fixed to best-effort bounded cancels)
Shutdownâ†’X10 Close Semantics: Shutdown code passed close-side/size into close_live_position; fixed to pass original_side (position side) + notional_usd
X10 Shutdown Close Strategy: reduce_only IOC closes now use top-of-book price (best bid/ask) with bounded tick-aggressive repricing to reduce CANCELLED closes
Maker Micro-Fill Policy (Lighter): bounded grace/max-wait + max unhedged USD threshold; abort cancels maker and dust-closes partial Lighter position (Implemented; needs log-based verification)
Spread/Entry-Gating: Maker orderbook validation now enforces MAX_SPREAD_FILTER_PERCENT to block wide-spread entries early
Spread Diagnostics: Fixed incorrect spread percent logging in maker timeout diagnostics
WS Ping/Pong Diagnostics: Enhanced keepalive loop with pings_sent/pongs_received/last_pong logging; on_pong callback for manager-level tracking
newly_discovered: X10 does NOT respond to application-level JSON pings - only WebSocket protocol pings work
Illiquid markets (e.g., EDEN-USD with ~7% spread) require percentage-based slippage (2-15%) instead of tick-based slippage (0.11% max)
remaining: TradeState Lifecycle: PENDING schon beim ersten Leg anlegen (Option C) wÃ¤re noch robuster fÃ¼r die Zukunft, aber Option B deckt das Risiko jetzt ab.
Strategie-Optimierung: Minimum Hold Time + Funding Collection vor Close
Long-Duration WS Test: Run bot for >30 minutes to confirm WS 1011 fix is stable long-term

key_signals: Opposite sign status flagged for multiple markets in audit (Bot vs Lighter)
Payment distribution differs strongly (Bot mostly positive vs Lighter mostly negative)
Bot side LONG while Lighter side short for same market/time in the audit samples

recommended_next_fix_options.option_A_safety_first: Wenn eine Position nur auf einem Exchange existiert (Orphan), sofort/automatisch schlieÃŸen + Alarm (keine Adoption)
recommended_next_fix_options.option_B_track_anyway: Orphan-Positionen als Recovery/PENDING TradeState anlegen (mindestens symbol/side/created_at), damit FundingTracker Funding nicht verliert
recommended_next_fix_options.option_C_best_long_term: TradeState bereits beim ersten Leg als PENDING anlegen und bei Hedge-Fail sauber rollback/close â†’ Funding immer zuordenbar
recommended_next_fix_options.option_D_ws_stability_first: POST-FIX: X10 WS stable (0 timeouts/reconnects) — monitor in long runs; no action unless regressions.
recommended_next_fix_options.option_E_reduce_debug_io: POST-FIX: Funding Raw Response now DEBUG-only; keep LOG_LEVEL=INFO to avoid IO pressure.
